wikipedia_page.main: John Webb (born 10 February 1952) is an English former professional footballer who played as a full back. Webb, who was active in England and North America, made over 150 career league appearances.

response: *John Webb (judge) (1926–2008), Associate Justice of the North Carolina Supreme Court
*John Webb (landscape designer) (1754–1828), English landscape designer; partner of William Emes
*John Webb's Mill, Thaxted, Thaxted, Essex, England

He did not play professional football for eight months. In the spring of 1977 he signed a contract with MVV Maastricht. The 28-year-old defender signed a provisional contract valid until the end of the season. He was signed to replace John Webb, who departed for the United States to serve out his outstanding contract with Chicago Sting.
